Comment: It isn’t, it’s still worse than what you had before.  You’re still paying 10% import tax on pretty much everything you buy from us except steel and aluminium, which we don’t make much of and sell even less to you. We export about 110k cars per year to you, and now instead of 0 tariffs you’ll pay 10% on the first 100k and 25% on anything above that.   There are once again zero tariffs on rolls Royce jet engines and plane parts, likely because about 15% of every f-variant fighter jet is UK produced parts.
